title: 9.3 Selection in Worst-Case Linear Time
content:
Section 9.3

Selection in Worst-Case Linear Time

Summary

The MEDIAN-OF-MEDIANS algorithm guarantees O(n) worst-case selection.

Key Points

  • Divide into groups of 5, find median of each group
  • Recursively find median of medians
  • Use median of medians as pivot → guaranteed good split
  • At least 3n/10 elements smaller AND 3n/10 larger
  • Recurrence: T(n) ≤ T(n/5) + T(7n/10) + O(n) = O(n)

Example

25 elements: 5 groups of 5, find 5 medians, find median of those 5. Use as pivot for guaranteed balanced partition.

Why It Matters

Proves selection can be done in linear time, though randomized is faster in practice.
